intro: Plesioneuron angiense, commonly known as the Angolan plesioneuron, is a rare and unique plant species native to specific regions of Angola. It belongs to the family Podostomaceae, which includes aquatic and semi-aquatic plants typically found in fast-flowing streams and rivers. The plant is characterized by its delicate, leaf-like structures that are adapted to thrive in submerged or partially submerged environments. Its reproductive structures are specialized for dispersal in water, contributing to its limited geographic distribution. Due to habitat loss and environmental changes, Plesioneuron angiense is considered a vulnerable species with limited conservation efforts underway.
